The only problem with setting the default device are slightly unclear semantics of this function, when used inside the with block. e.g.

with torch.cuda.device(1):
    torch.cuda.set_default_device(2)
    y = torch.cuda.FloatTensor(2)
    # does the default device selection affect the block?
    # y.get_device() == 2 or y.get_device() == 1?
x = torch.cuda.FloatTensor(2)
# after all with clauses do we return to the new default device or to the old one?
# x.get_device() == 2 or x.get_device() == 0?

body:
The only problem with setting the default device are slightly unclear semantics of this function, when used inside the `with` block. e.g.

```python
with torch.cuda.device(1):
    torch.cuda.set_default_device(2)
    y = torch.cuda.FloatTensor(2)
    # does the default device selection affect the block?
    # y.get_device() == 2 or y.get_device() == 1?
x = torch.cuda.FloatTensor(2)
# after all with clauses do we return to the new default device or to the old one?
# x.get_device() == 2 or x.get_device() == 0?
```
